messages.message: Question for eng, has there been any work or any libraries out there we can use to just remove handwriting/noise thats not text for an area, right now BAML has a problem where they want to remove everything outside the machine printed text.
@Matt I think that is only part of the problem though, because the second piece would be reconstructing whatever is underneath the noise, similar to the Photoshop magic wand  deletion tool

Yeah totally but curious if we had a feature like that, it may lead to just slightly better results. Not asking for any eng effort to be put onto it but curious if we ever thought about it and if we could because if it gives 10% lift it may provide value. More of a thought exercise right now

we do have custom image filters in Process Files — we just need someone to experiment with some image magick or opencv code that attempts to remove these kinds of curves and handwriting cc: @Jonathan Shih — this could be an internship project category for Isha.

But ya, we’d have to ask someone to experiment with this Matt cc: @Aaron Vontell — you can use custom image filters to experiment with this on instabase.com (http://instabase.com) if you want
